messages: da0e57e706a98c1977faf3a3cf26b5eb (17:40): hey guys , got a quick question
da0e57e706a98c1977faf3a3cf26b5eb (17:41): i have this command spool /opt/oracle/chrysalis_daily_export/data/chrysalis_daily_export.txt
da0e57e706a98c1977faf3a3cf26b5eb (17:41): can i edit it so that the spool file as the date it was created?
e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (17:48): why you are not Master of Oracle ?
e3bece16a9b102049571aab163e47582 (17:48): I saw a page at Oracle

443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (17:51): [algo]: oracle doesn't even know i exist
da0e57e706a98c1977faf3a3cf26b5eb (17:53): hali ?? can you help me out please......
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (17:53): Snake007uk: 1 sec and i'll pastebin an example

443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (17:57): so what we do is ... first command is to define that the output from d shoulw be stored in file_date
da0e57e706a98c1977faf3a3cf26b5eb (17:57): hali  i am using sql plus
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (17:57): second command is to select the date into file_date
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (17:58): yes that is from sqlplus indeed
da0e57e706a98c1977faf3a3cf26b5eb (17:58): let me paste the sql plus code i was given
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (17:59): yes, just put those two commands in before the spool and change the spool file name to have &file_date. in it
da0e57e706a98c1977faf3a3cf26b5eb (18:05): hali workd 100% YOU ARE the man :)
